results.title: China: changes from within (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Focuses on the manifestations of social economic and political changes that are taking place in China. These changes will take place over a long time, however the atmosphere which has allowed them is evidence of a trend towards a more ‘democratic socialism’.
results.description: Focuses on the manifestations of social economic and political changes that are taking place in China. These changes will take place over a long time, however the atmosphere which has allowed them is evidence of a trend towards a more ‘democratic socialism’.

results.title: China. Part 3. Life in the city
results.brief_description: Shows daily life in Peking, including scenes of schooling, shopping, religious ceremonies, and construction of new blocks of flats and a causeway. Describes the emphasis placed on health and fitness. Edited version of “China!”.

results.title: China. Part 2. Life in the country
results.brief_description: Reveals China as a land of contrasts. Shows sheep herding in the Sunkiang province, terraced hillsides planted with rice in the more temperate areas, inland lakes and rivers which provide fish, life in country towns, and harvesting activities. Edited from “China!”.

results.title: Children of the street
results.creator_credit: Francois Fioquet and Via le Monde
results.brief_description: Looks at lives of two newspaper boys in Caracas, Venezuela, who work up to nine hours a day to make a living on the streets of a tough city, and to earn money for an education. Useful as a comparison with a lifestyle very different to that experienced by most Australian children.

results.title: Children of the Peloponnese
results.creator_credit: Daniel Bertolino and Via le Monde
results.brief_description: Depicts the life style of families in the central Peloponnese region on Greece concentrating on the children. Shows the long, arduous walk they must take each day to go to school in another village, schooling, aspects of culture and sex roles.

results.title: Children of the high rise
results.brief_description: Examines the effects on children of high-rise living. Looks at how adequately their needs are catered for, and considers what the children themselves think of life high above the ground.

results.title: Children of other lands: Scandinavia
results.creator_credit: Clyde E. Elliott and Post Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Documentary on the children of Norway, Sweden and Lapland, their social life and traditions compared to those of the United States. Suitable for lower and middle primary school levels.

results.title: Children are people
results.creator_credit: Lorna Ridgeway, Dan Douglas and Stockwell College of Education
results.brief_description: Shows a successful teaching experiment in primary schools in which classes are grouped vertically to include mixed ages, brothers and sisters. Explains how best children can be grouped and taught together so that they all enjoy school, learn effectively and develop their potential ability. Furthermore, it is claimed in the film that a more satisfactory social situation is created where social devlopment is fostered to a greater degree than in single-age groups.

results.title: Children's thought and language
results.creator_credit: Michael Forlong Productions and Stefan Sargent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Looking at Research”.
The film outlines a project sponsored by the Social Science Research Council to study childhood development of intelligence and to discover how much children understand.
